Infrastructure.Column2: Design and Construction of Sea Outfall of Sour Wastewater Treatment Plant
Infrastructure.Column7:
The works included the following:
- Design and build of an OD 1200 mm sea-outfall pipe to discharge 35,000 m3/day sewerage (Onshore and Offshore).
- Onshore part consisting of GRP DN 1100 mm pipe of depth 3 m and total length 585 meters connected to the WWTP.
- Offshore pipe, 1200 mm diameter, concrete encased for the first 600 meters, and 915 meters with concrete blocks and accropode protection. 315 mm diameter diffusers were fixed to the last 165 meters of the sea-outfall with cathodic protection. 
- The offshore pipe was installed as 3 parts butt fusion welded and flanged ends, using the flooding system.                   
The scope of works includes but is not limited to: excavation, marine trenching, bedding, backfilling, installation of anchor blocks, diffusers, duck bill valves, weight collars, deep water and surf zone rock armoring, pressure testing, pig entry chamber construction, jointing land based to marine pipe.

Rayak Medical Hospital Building
Buildings.Column5: Dr. Ali Hussein Al Abdullah and Dr. Ali Hamad Al Abdullah
Buildings.Column7:
The project is located in Rayak on plot 57, which is a 5-storey hospital with a total area of 12,996 m2. And green areas were created with a surrounding fence. The hospital consists of Two Sections (A and B).

Section B consists of:
- Basement: includes a kitchen, a laundry room, a staff dormitory, etc…
- Ground floor and includes the obstetrics department, which is a section dedicated to the postpartum stage, and includes nursing staff and women's information Center.
- First floor, which is specialized for children and includes a Children's Care Center (ICN)
- Second floor is specialized for the archives and the clinics, in addition to a hall, restroom and bathrooms

Section A consists of:
- A basement floor that includes a theater, a lecture hall (125 seats), a library, a gymnasium and a pharmacy, a mechanical room, secured rooms for condemned patients (special for the Government), warehouses for the pharmacy and mortuary.
- Basement floor and includes emergency, x-ray laboratories and operating rooms.

- Ground floor and includes administration, cafeteria, accounting, entrance offices, outpatient clinics. reception and physiotherapy department.

- First floor includes nursing rooms, recovery rooms, rooms for neurology patients, dialysis department, ICU department & rooms.

- Second floor, which includes CCU, cardiac surgery and operating rooms, observation building, surgical operations building and a special building for surgical patients.

- Waste incinerator, 4 generator rooms & fuel tanks
As for the number of beds for hospital projects, it is one hundred and fifty (150) beds.

The works are divided as follow:
- Civil works: consisting of excavation works, structural concrete works, plaster and paint works, carpentry works (interior doors), aluminum works (exterior doors and windows), waterproofing works, tiling works and stone cladding.

- Electrical works include a transformer station, external lighting poles, electrical network (power & lighting), 3 generators + UPS room

Landscaping works include water supply works with feeding pumps, landscaping,  green spaces & sidewalks

- Works of special rooms for the mortuary.

- Works for a crematorium room.

Roads.Column2: Asphalting the Line in Sirob Town - Saida
Roads.Column7:

- Cut the pitch along the line
- Leveling and compacting the layers of the trench above the backfilling layer around the caliper, along with all the necessary works in preparation for the paving and asphalting works.
- Paving with crushed gravel Tout Venant by flashing it and spraying it with water and stacking it with a thickness of not less than 15 cm after edging and according to the required specifications over the entire width of the trench. - An adhesive layer to be sprayed on the final paving layer after tamping at a rate of 1,200 g/m2 provided that it sprays the vertical sides of the old asphalt layer.
- Asphalt over trenches, serving, flashing and stacking a layer of asphalt
Providing the Asphalt Mix Design for the indicated and necessary asphalt works
- business report
